trans-unit.source: Implements <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> and provides the base implementation for remotable components that are marshaled by value (a copy of the serialized object is passed).
A component can be contained in a container.
For each component in a container, the container creates a site that it uses to manage the component.
The component interacts with its container primarily through a container-provided <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>, which is a repository of container-specific, per-component information.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent"></xref> class.
A component can be contained in a container.
For each component in a container, the container creates a site that it uses to manage the component.
The component interacts with its container primarily through a container-provided <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite>, which is a repository of container-specific, per-component information.
Gets the container for the component.
An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IContainer"></xref> interface that represents the component's container, or `null` if the component does not have a site.
Gets a value indicating whether the component is currently in design mode.
If the component does not have a site, this method always returns `false`.
`true` if the component is in design mode; otherwise, `false`.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
Always call <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent> object's `Finalize` method.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
This method is called by the public `Dispose()` method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Adds an event handler to listen to the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.MarshalByValueComponent.Disposed"></xref> event on the component.
Gets the list of event handlers that are attached to this component.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EventHandlerList"></xref> that provides the delegates for this component.
Allows an object to try to free resources and perform other cleanup operations before it is reclaimed by garbage collection.
Gets the implementer of the <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref>.
For more information on designer services you can use, see [Design-Time Architecture](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/4881917b-628f-4689-b872-472e4f8a4e3a).
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type of service you want.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the implementer of the <xref href="System.IServiceProvider"></xref>.
Gets or sets the site of the component.
A valid value for this property - that is, the value is not `null`, indicates that the component has been added to a container.
When the value of this property is `null`, the property indicates that the component is being removed from a container.
However, this property does not remove the component from the container.
An object implementing the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ISite"></xref> interface that represents the site of the component.
Returns a <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any.
This method should not be overridden.
A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> may or may not have a name.
If a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> is given a name, the name is unique among other <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> objects within its <xref:System.ComponentModel.IContainer>.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite> stores the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component>'s name.

A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component> can only have a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite> if it has been added to an <xref:System.ComponentModel.IContainer> and the <xref:System.ComponentModel.IContainer> assigns an <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISite> to it.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> containing the name of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref>, if any.
`null` if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Component"></xref> is unnamed.
